lead_paragraph: An armed group that is occupying a wildlife reserve in Oregon has called for Washington to hand control of federal lands to ranchers and local governments.

byline.contributor: Kirk Johnson reported from Burns, and Jack Healy from Denver.
byline.original: By KIRK JOHNSON and JACK HEALY

snippet: An armed group that is occupying a wildlife reserve in Oregon has called for Washington to hand control of federal lands to ranchers and local governments.

headline.main: Protesters in Oregon Seek to End Policy That Shaped West
headline.print_headline: Protesters Seek to End Policy That Shaped West

abstract: Group of armed protesters occupying federal wildlife reserve in east-central Oregon and calling for government to release lands are seeking to undo policy that has for century defined American West; group's stated goal is to return control of land to loggers, ranchers and local governments, whose fortunes they say federal government has harmed.
